definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: The telephone roused me from my sleep in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早晨电话声把我从睡梦中弄醒了。

sentences.english: No waking me up when you come in at night using your BlackBerry as a flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 别半夜进屋把黑莓手机当手电筒使把我弄醒。

sentences.english: If the baby slept soundly, but also need not have to wake him on time feeding.
sentences.chinese: 如果宝宝睡得很香，也大可不必非要弄醒他按时喂奶。

sentences.english: After he s revived he tells Galvatron what happened.
sentences.chinese: 瘟疫被弄醒后告诉了惊破天事情的经过。

sentences.english: We were awakened by the whoops of the sick baby.
sentences.chinese: 生病婴儿的喘息声把我们弄醒了。

sentences.english: She was awoken by the noise.
One night, Joseph's mother was woken up by her son.
sentences.chinese: 一天夜里，约瑟夫的母亲被儿子弄醒了。

sentences.english: She rustled across the paper bag, and awakened Benjamin Bunny.
sentences.chinese: 她沙沙作响地越过纸袋，因此弄醒了本杰明兔子。

sentences.english: Cries are required from those who wake disturbed at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些在黎明时分被弄醒的人来说，喊叫是必须的。

sentences.english: He was awakened once from a faint by a wheeze close in his ear.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，在昏迷中他被一种贴近耳边的喘息声弄醒了。

sentences.english: Maybe Susan wanted to read without waking him.
sentences.chinese: 或许苏珊想看看书而不弄醒麦克。

sentences.english: The sun glaring through the window woke me up.
sentences.chinese: 早上，刺眼的阳光射进窗户，把我弄醒了。

sentences.english: I think that isn't gonna work. Wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 我想我做不来了，把他弄醒。

sentences.english: He has a restless night and is apparently woken by a tree branch tapping on the window.
sentences.chinese: 他一晚上没得安宁，一枝树枝拍打窗户把他弄醒。

sentences.english: I was woken by a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 我被一阵响亮的吵闹声弄醒了。

sentences.english: One night he awoke with diarrhea and stumbled to the public outhouse.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，他被腹泻弄醒，跌跌撞撞地去外屋公厕。

definition: to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to wake sb up with a noise
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
to send sb away (with an excuse)
